The Barber of Seville, or The Futile Precaution is an opera buffa in two acts by 
Gioachino Rossini with an Italian libretto by Cesare Sterbini. The libretto was 
based on Pierre Beaumarchais's French comedy Le Barbier de Sville (1775).
